Posts.Content: Mar 1, 2009 09:21AM mediamaid wrote: I like the thought of this. March 1, 2005 was my diagnosis date so I'd rather have something nice to think about on this day. I have to admit, though, that I am thankful for the diagnosis as it means the cancer was found before it was untreatable. If it hadn't been found when it was, my story might not have such a nice ending. I'm four years out and doing fine. Thanks for sharing. It's always nice to learn how people from other countries and cultures celebrate. We can all use a little health and good luck.
Posts.Title: 1st of March Tradition Tucheta aprilintexas
